repo.name: openllmetry
repo.description: Open-source observability for your GenAI or LLM application, based on OpenTelemetry

readme.summary: Clear and professional documentation with excellent getting started guide, but lacks concrete examples beyond basic setup and has minimal troubleshooting content.
readme.top_issue: No examples showing actual OpenAI instrumentation usage or what traced data looks like, only shows SDK initialization without demonstrating the core instrumentation functionality.

common_complaints: Library compatibility issues with new versions (Weaviate v4, qdrant-client v1.16.1)
Incomplete instrumentation coverage (missing OpenAI structured outputs, DSPy framework)
Critical context management bugs affecting trace integrity (context_api orphaned calls)
Error logging gaps for HTTP failures from foundation model APIs
praise_themes: Community engagement with help wanted labels
Feature requests aligned with ecosystem trends (DSPy, structured outputs)
sentiment.summary: Project shows moderate health with active bug reports and feature requests, but reveals gaps in dependency version tracking and instrumentation completeness that could frustrate users integrating with latest library versions.

concerns: No commits in the past 6 months despite last commit being 4 days ago (data inconsistency suggests stale repository)
328 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
Zero closed issues in the past 6 months indicating no active maintenance
No merged PRs in the past 6 months showing lack of development activity
No active contributors in the past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release information is unavailable or outdated
maintenance.summary: This package is abandoned with no maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite a recent timestamp, indicating the repository is no longer actively maintained.

project_metrics.description: Open-source observability for your GenAI or LLM application, based on OpenTelemetry

common_complaints: API breakage from Telegram updates (TLObject parsing errors)
Authentication and login flow issues

Concurrent coroutine errors in message iteration
Parameter values being ignored (invert_media)
Proxy connectivity issues
praise_themes: Appreciation for maintainer effort despite frustration
sentiment.summary: Telethon shows signs of maintenance struggles with unresolved API compatibility issues, slow response times to user problems, and accumulating technical debt from Telegram API changes.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being Jan 4, 2026

repo.name: pycryptodome
repo.description: A self-contained cryptographic library for Python

cves.summary: PyCryptodome and pycryptodomex side-channel leakage for OAEP decryption
PyCryptodome and pycryptodomex before 3.19.1 allow side-channel leakage for OAEP decryption, exploitable for a Manger attack.

readme.summary: Clear overview and installation but completely lacks usage examples, quick start guide, and troubleshooting information.
readme.top_issue: No code examples or quick start guide showing how to actually use any cryptographic functions

common_complaints: Platform-specific installation issues (M1 Mac native module loading)
Python version compatibility gaps (Python 3.14 support, xrange legacy code)
Missing modern security features (PyPI Trusted Publisher)
praise_themes: Gratitude for maintaining the project as successor to abandoned pycrypto
Recognition of project's critical role in cryptography ecosystem
sentiment.summary: Pycryptodomex shows healthy community engagement with active issue handling across security concerns, feature requests, and platform compatibility—maintainers are responsive but have limited bandwidth for infrastructure modernization.

concerns: No commits in the past 6 months despite last commit being from November 2025

repo.description: Pygments is a generic syntax highlighter written in Python

cves.summary: Pygments vulnerable to Regular Expression Denial of Service (ReDoS)
A ReDoS issue was discovered in pygments/lexers/smithy.py in pygments through 2.15.0 via SmithyLexer.
An infinite loop in SMLLexer in Pygments versions 1.5 to 2.7.3 may lead to denial of service when performing syntax highlighting of a Standard ML (SML) source file, as demonstrated by input that only

In pygments 1.1+, fixed in 2.7.4, the lexers used to parse programming languages rely heavily on regular expressions. Some of the regular expressions have exponential or cubic worst-case complexity an
The FontManager._get_nix_font_path function in formatters/img.py in Pygments 1.2.2 through 2.0.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary commands via shell metacharacters in a font name.

readme.summary: The README provides a good introduction to the package and its installation, but lacks clear examples and quick start guides.
readme.top_issue: Lack of clear examples and quick start guides for new users

security.summary: The provided Pygments code sample appears to be secure, with no injection risks or secrets found, but may benefit from additional input validation and error handling.

common_complaints: support for single-line comments in LESS and SCSS/SASS
sentiment.summary: The community is currently focused on feature requests, with no signs of major issues or abandonment.

communication.summary: The responses are generally clear and helpful, showing patience with new contributors.

concerns: Low merged PRs in the past six months
positive_signals: Recent commits in the last month
maintenance.summary: The package is maintained with recent activity, but there are concerns about unresolved issues and low PR merge rate.
